master class
Sección
VOLUMEN DE PRISMAS

¡Mira a tu alrededor! Desde la pantalla que tienes enfrente hasta el ladrillo de una pared, nuestra vida está rodeada de formas que tienen una belleza y un poder ocultos: los Prismas. Un prisma no es solo un cuerpo geométrico; es el arquitecto silencioso detrás de la estabilidad y la utilidad en nuestro mundo. Es el diseño que permite que una caja contenga un regalo especial, que un armario guarde tus recuerdos o que un edificio se eleve con firmeza contra el cielo.

¿Qué hace tan especial a un Prisma?
 

Su magia reside en su estructura: un prisma es un sólido con dos bases idénticas, perfectamente planas y paralelas, conectadas por caras laterales rectangulares o cuadradas. Es la forma más honesta y fundamental de empaquetar, construir y contener.

Text and Tasks
Saberes previos
Saberes previos

Antes de aprender a calcular el volumen de un prisma, es importante recordar que todo objeto ocupa un espacio. Cuando usamos una caja, un envase o un contenedor, lo que realmente nos interesa no es solo su forma, sino cuánto puede guardar en su interior.
A ese espacio interno que puede contener un objeto lo llamamos volumen.
Hoy comenzaremos identificando esta idea a partir de situaciones de la vida real para comprender que el volumen no es solo una fórmula, sino una medida que usamos constantemente sin darnos cuenta.

¿Dónde encontramos prismas en la vida real?
Introducción

En nuestro entorno, estamos rodeados de objetos con forma de prisma, aunque muchas veces no nos damos cuenta. Las cajas de regalo, los ladrillos, los edificios, e incluso algunos envases de productos tienen esta forma.
Comprender qué es un prisma y cómo se calcula su volumen nos permite analizar el espacio que ocupan los objetos y planificar construcciones, embalajes o diseños de manera eficiente.

En este módulo aprenderás qué es un prisma, cuáles son sus partes, cómo se calcula su área y su volumen, y para qué sirve realmente conocer estos conceptos en la vida cotidiana.

Un prisma se parece a una caja con caras planas y rectas. Si un objeto tiene forma redonda o curva, como una pelota o un cono, no es un prisma.
Piensa en una caja de regalo o un bloque de construcción: esas sí son buenos ejemplos para comenzar a identificar los prismas.

Text and Tasks
¿Qué es un prisma?

Un prisma es un sólid o geométrico que tiene dos bases iguales y paralelas, y el resto de sus caras son rectángulos.
Imagina una caja de zapatos, un ladrillo o un envase rectangular de leche. Todos tienen una forma parecida: sus caras laterales son planas y sus dos bases son idénticas.
Text and Tasks
En términos sencillos:
Un prisma es como una figura plana (triángulo, cuadrado, rectángulo, etc.) que se “alarga” en una dirección.
Text and Tasks
Partes de un prisma

Para comprender mejor un prisma, debemos identificar sus elementos principales:

  • Base: Es la figura geométrica que se repite. Puede ser un triángulo, cuadrado, rectángulo, pentágono, etc.
  • Altura (h): Es la distancia perpendicular entre las dos bases. Representa cuánto “se extiende” el prisma.
  • Caras laterales: Son los rectángulos que unen una base con la otra.
  • Aristas: Son los bordes del prisma, es decir, donde se unen dos caras.
  • Vértices: Son los puntos donde se encuentran tres aristas.
Text and Tasks
Fórmula del Volumen del Prisma

Para calcular el volumen de un prisma, necesitamos saber cuánta superficie ocupa su base y cuánto se extiende esa base en altura.

Área de la base (Aᵦ) → depende de la forma de la base (triángulo, cuadrado, rectángulo, etc.)
Altura (h) → es la distancia entre las dos bases.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

Text and Tasks

A continuación veremos los distintos tipos de prismas, sus
                                                                                           elementos, como hallar su volumen  y a practicar.
Text and Tasks
Tipos de prismas

Un prisma es un cuerpo geométrico tridimensional con dos bases poligonales idénticas y paralelas, unidas por caras laterales que son paralelogramos. El tipo de prisma se define por la forma de sus bases, como en el caso de un prisma triangular, con dos bases de triángulo, o un prisma pentagonal, con dos bases de pentágono.
Text and Tasks
Prisma Triangular

Un prisma triangular es un poliedro (una figura geométrica tridimensional) que se caracteriza por tener cinco caras: dos de ellas son sus bases, que tienen forma de triángulo y son congruentes y paralelas entre sí, y las otras tres son sus caras laterales, que generalmente son rectángulos (en el caso de un prisma recto) y conectan los lados correspondientes de las bases.

Partes principales del prisma triangular

Base: tiene forma de triángulo (son dos, la superior y la inferior).
Altura (h): es la distancia perpendicular entre las dos bases triangulares.
Caras laterales: tiene 3 caras laterales, todas con forma de rectángulo (en un prisma recto).
Aristas: tiene un total de 9 aristas (6 en las bases y 3 laterales).
Vértices: tiene 6 vértices (3 en cada base).
Arista lateral: es el segmento que conecta las bases y representa la altura

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Cloze Activity
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.
Prisma Rectangular

Un prisma rectangular es un sólido geométrico que tiene como base un rectángulo, y sus caras laterales también son rectángulos.
Ejemplo cotidiano: una caja de zapatos, un ladrillo o un envase de leche.

Partes principales del prisma rectangular

• Base: tiene forma de rectángulo.
  • Altura (h): distancia entre las dos bases.
  • Caras laterales: tiene 4 caras laterales, todas con forma de rectángulo.
  • Aristas: cuenta con 12 aristas.
  • Vértices: tiene 8 vértices.

Área de la base = 4 x 2 = 8 cm²
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

Prisma Pentagonal

Un prisma pentagonal es un poliedro, una figura geométrica tridimensional, que se caracteriza por tener dos bases en forma de pentágono (polígono de cinco lados).Esencialmente, es una figura cuyas bases son pentágonos congruentes (iguales) y paralelos, y están conectadas por caras laterales.

Partes principales del prisma Pentagonal

Bases (2): Dos caras con forma de pentágono. Son congruentes y paralelas.
Caras Laterales (5): Cinco caras que unen las bases. En un prisma recto, son rectángulos.
Caras Totales: Suma de bases y caras laterales: 2+5=7 caras. (Se trata de un heptaedro).
Vértices (10): Diez puntos donde se encuentran las aristas (cinco en cada base).
Aristas (15): Quince segmentos de línea (cinco en la base superior, cinco en la inferior, y cinco laterales).

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Cloze Activity
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.
Prisma Hexagonal

Un prisma hexagonal es un poliedro (figura geométrica tridimensional) que se define por tener dos bases con forma de hexágono (polígono de seis lados).Sus dos bases hexagonales son congruentes (iguales) y paralelas, y están conectadas por seis caras laterales.

Partes principales del prisma Pentagonal

Bases (2): Dos caras con forma de hexágono (polígono de 6 lados).
Caras Laterales (6): Seis caras que conectan los lados de las bases. En un prisma recto, son rectángulos.
Caras Totales: 2(bases)+6(laterales)=8 caras. (Es un octaedro).
Vértices (12): Doce puntos de unión de las aristas (seis en cada base).
Aristas (18): Dieciocho segmentos de línea (seis en la base superior, seis en la inferior y seis laterales).
Altura (h): La distancia perpendicular entre las dos bases hexagonales.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!

Finalmente multiplicamos el área de la base por la altura y trendremos el volumen o el contenido del prisma.

El Primer paso para calcular el volumen es el área de la base donde la formula es multiplicar el largo por el ancho.

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible

¿Por qué al calcular el volumen de un prisma siempre se utilizan unidades cúbicas (ej. m3 , cm3) en lugar de unidades cuadradas (ej. m2, cm2?

Las unidades cúbicas son el resultado de multiplicar tres dimensiones (distancias), lo cual es la definición esencial del volumen.
Enter the available choices here. You can add options by clicking the "Add another option" button. Delete options by clicking the red X next to the option.
Porque el cálculo siempre involucra el área de la base al cuadrado.

Las unidades cúbicas representan la medida del espacio en tres dimensiones (largo, ancho y altura), mientras que las cuadradas solo miden dos.

Lista de cotejo
EVALUANDO LO APRENDIDO

CRITERIO DE EVALUACIÓN CUMPLE (Sí) NO CUMPLE (No) OBSERVACIONES / EVIDENCIA
1. Identifico y modelo correctamente la forma del prisma propuesto (rectangular, cuadrado, etc.).
2. Determino y aplico correctamente la fórmula para el área de la base del diseño que elegí.
3. Aplico correctamente la fórmula universal del volumen al diseño que propuse. 
4. Utilizo con precisión los términos: volumen, área de la base, altura y capacidad en mi justificación escrita.
5. Registro dimensiones (largo, ancho, altura) que son lógicas y coherentes con un objeto real y con las unidades que elegí
